DataElement.preferredName: Negation Clinical Trial Cellular Therapy Administered Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation that describes the reason that a non-clinical trial cellular therapy was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Clinical Trial Cellular Therapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Institution Guideline And/Or Standard Therapeutic Procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Institution Guideline And/Or Standard Therapeutic Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.: Directions or principles presenting current or future rules of policy. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by the convening of expert panels. The text may be cursive or in outline form but is generally a comprehensive guide to problems and approaches in any field of activity. For guidelines in the field of health care and clinical medicine, PRACTICE GUIDELINES is available.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Regularly and widely used.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.

A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Providing experimental therapies to very sick individuals even though they don't meet the critera for inclusion in a trial.
